edu.umn.shibboleth.sp
[Groovy] Class ShibbolethUserDetailsService

java.lang.Object
  edu.umn.shibboleth.sp.ShibbolethUserDetailsService
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.AuthenticationUserDetailsService
class ShibbolethUserDetailsService

Abstract class for using the provided Shibboleth assertion to construct a new ShibbolethUser object. This generally is most useful when combined with additional exposed attributes returned to the Shibboleth native SP from the IdP.

Reference Documentation

  • Spring Security Documentation
  • Grails Spring Security Core Documentation
Authors:
Aaron J. Zirbes

Field Detail

DEFAULT_AUTHORITIES

private static final java.util.List DEFAULT_AUTHORITIES
Some Spring Security classes (e.g. RoleHierarchyVoter) expect at least one role, so we give a user with no granted roles this one which gets past that restriction but doesn't grant anything.

DEFAULT_ROLES_ATTRIBUTE

private static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_ROLES_ATTRIBUTE

DEFAULT_ROLES_PREFIX

private static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_ROLES_PREFIX

DEFAULT_ROLES_SEPARATOR

private static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_ROLES_SEPARATOR

registeredUsers

private final java.util.Map registeredUsers
This is to support the RememberMeService

 
Property Detail

authenticationMethodRoles

java.util.HashMap authenticationMethodRoles
This is a map of roles to apply when specific authentication methods are used. This is primarily used to identify guest or two-factor authentication.

identityProviderRoles

java.util.HashMap identityProviderRoles
This is a collection of map objects that contain a role, and an associated identity provider. This can be used to identify the IdP that authenticated the logged in user.

ipAddressRoles

java.lang.Object ipAddressRoles
This is a collection of map objects that contain a role, and an associated collection of remote ip address ranges that cause the role to be applied. This can be used to identify when two-factor authentication is needed based on the clients network. This configuration attribute is why this is still a Groovy class

rolesAttribute

java.lang.String rolesAttribute
This is the exposed attribute that contains the user's roles

rolesPrefix

java.lang.String rolesPrefix
This is the prefix to apply to all the roles loaded from the exposed roles attribute

rolesSeparator

java.lang.String rolesSeparator
This is the delimiter for the roles attribute value
